intro: Rungia diversiformis, commonly known as the variable rungia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and can vary in shape, contributing to its common name. Rungia diversiformis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
